main event: A civilian engineer observed a white, changing to red, to blue, and back to white object about the size of a car headlight in the sky for about an hour in Yorktown, New York on October 25, 1966.
interesting points: The object moved very slowly, about 2-3 feet per hour, in an unknown direction.
The observer used binoculars to observe the object.
The object was determined to likely be the star Arcturus, based on the opinion of a senior navigator at Stewart Air Force Base.
The weather conditions were clear, with visibility over 15 miles and no cloud cover.
No photographs or physical evidence were obtained from the sighting.
sighted object: A single, oval-shaped, white, changing to red, to blue, and back to white object
